title: Citi Pakistan Awarded for 'Best Practices in CSR' by United Nations Global Compact Pakistan Network
summary: Pakistan - To inspire the business community to follow the lead taken by businesses in the area of sustainability, the United Nations Global Compact Pakistan Network has awarded Citi Pakistan for its 'Best Practices in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR).' This recognition comes on the heels of three other recent global CSR awards that Citi Pakistan has won during 2011 and 2012.
tag-1: Citi Pakistan Awarded for 'Best Practices in CSR' by United Nations Global Compact Pakistan Network
tag-2: Pakistan – To inspire the business community to follow the lead taken by businesses in the area of sustainability, the United Nations Global Compact Pakistan Network has awarded Citi Pakistan for its 'Best Practices in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR).' This recognition comes on the heels of three other recent global CSR awards that Citi Pakistan has won during 2011 and 2012.
tag-3: Citi Pakistan has recently been awarded three international CSR awards at the Global CSR Summit, Asian-Intel CSR Awards and at the International CSR Summit for its pioneering work in the microfinance and education spheres in Pakistan. Contributing to measurable, sustainable community programs is a core part of Citi's strategy, both globally and in country.
tag-4: At the event, Haroon Saeed from Citi Pakistan's Corporate Bank in Lahore, said, "Citi Pakistan is humbled at receiving this award. Responsible Finance is a key operating principle at Citi, and we hope to continue supporting the communities where we live and operate and to continue providing best practices in CSR for other market participants to follow."
tag-5: In addition to being valuable, innovative partners in progress for its diverse client base, one of Citi's core principles is to invest in the communities where it operates. In Pakistan, the bank has aimed to incorporate a long-term, sustainable community engagement program into its mainstream business strategy. Citi Pakistan's social governance roadmap is two-pronged: it incorporates financial investment from the Citi Foundation (Citi's philanthropic arm), coupled with on-the-ground volunteer efforts. From entrepreneurship to financial capability and asset-building to disaster relief, to vocational training and post-secondary education, with a particular focus on women and youth, Citi Pakistan has always aimed to create strong social networks and meaningful partnerships in order to impact sustainable development in the country.
tag-6: The United Nations Global Compact is a strategic policy initiative for businesses that are committed to aligning their operations and strategies with 10 universally accepted principles in the areas of human rights, labor, environment and anti-corruption. United Nations Global Compact Pakistan is organizing the National Global Compact Conference under the theme 'Sustaining Best Business Practices.' The award was conferred on the eve of the Conference in its inaugural session.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
